text: I have a finance background and I wanted
to find a career that allow me to to
take what I've learned on Wall Street
and be able to mesh it within this the
sphere of Education reform and poverty
alleviation when I first got to to HBS I
was overwhelmed by the amount of support
and interest in Social Enterprise um I
had no idea it was one of the largest
student groups on campus with over 400
students and and it wasn't just people
who came from a nonprofit background
they were individuals like myself that
had private sector training like I came
from Wall Street and there's people who
were entrepreneurs people who were in
finance and VC and PE and people who had
were teachers so there was just such a
richness of diversity and students who
were interested in Social Enterprise I
decided to do a joint degree at Harvard
Kennedy School of government and Harvard
Business School I understood from a
policy perspective I had to get a better
understanding of how polic is created
coupled with that I knew I needed to
enhance my business skills
music has always been a great part of my
life I've been fortunate enough to to DJ
I I think over a hundred events over the
3 years that I've been here and it's
just been a great way to be introduced
to different clubs um different students
from um all across the campus and uh
music has just been a great connector
for me and and I loved
it after I graduate I'll be joining the
leadership team of the Harlem Children
Zone doing nonprofit management my title
is the Special Assistant of the CEO and
I'll have various responsibilities which
include strategic initiatives
fundraising and budget maintenance um
hopefully coaching some basketball some
school management um helping to develop
our young professional
pipeline the most surprising thing that
I've learned at at HBS is the emphasis
on getting to know who you are and
yourself because the ability to identify
what your core values are um what makes
it your true character um will better
guide the search in terms of trying to
to find what career path is best for you
I think first and foremost this is a
very diverse and Rich community so we
have artists here we have DJs we have
dancers professional athletes uh you
name it that fullness of character is
what HBS students will bring um to their
respective careers as they leave HBS
